result.execSummary:
The defendant Chauncey G Weller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

--Mr. Weller must successfully complete the First Offenders Program on other charges [uncharged referral no case number]
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening (atleast one time per month for first 3 months; thereafter, per agent)
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent

The Court grants Mr. Weller the opportunity to request expungement of this case upon successful completion of Probation.

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Arresting Agency: JCSD

timeConds.notes: to serve 5 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  4/26 /15 at 7:00am

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from the defendant ref huber

[MK] case called briefly at 4:09pm, and then again at 4:12pm.
Defendant Chauncey G Weller in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation Agent Carrie Reuhl is in court.
Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 
Mr. Weller makes a statement. 

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Weller to:
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail; to commence forthwith  

On Count #3, the Court sentences Mr. Weller to: 
--serve five month in Jefferson County Jail; consecutive to Count #1

The Court allows Huber privileges only after Mr. Weller has served the first four months of the aggregate jail term in this case has been served.
Days credit for time already served given:  54 days 
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment on the costs set forth in the Revocation Summary. 
recess 4:45pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 07-21-2015 03:45 pm
Letter from the Sheriff re huber revocation
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 9:42am [mo]
Defendant Chauncey G Weller in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1 & #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall 
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Huebner
The Court and Mr. Weller have colloquy about his participation in FOP on other charges

On Counts #1 & #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--On Count #1 Mr. Weller is to serve 5 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  4/26 /15 at 7:00am
--Mr. Weller must successfully complete the First Offenders Program on other charges [uncharged referral no case number]
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening (atleast one time per month for first 3 months; thereafter, per agent)
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--On Count #1 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3 to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay $50 drug testing fee

The Court grants Mr. Weller the opportunity to request expungement of this case upon successful completion of Probation. 
Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess: 10:06am
Status conference on April 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 1, 2015 at 09:20 am.

[MK] case called at 2:42pm. 
Defendant Chauncey G Weller in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.
recess 2:44am.


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/1/15 at 9:20am.    (2)  Status Conference on 4/21/15 at 9:30am
Adjourned initial appearance on March 17, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

case called at 3:11pm. [MK]
Defendant Chauncey G Weller in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, the charges and maximum penalties are recited, the reading of the factual portion of the Criminal Complaint is waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Mr. Weller verifies that he heard the Court give information on right to counsel, and that constructive waiver of counsel warnings were given.
After Mr. Weller indicates that he wishes to be represented by counsel, the Court adjourns the Initial Apperance. 

The Court requires $500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 
--no contact with Shane Chaisorn
--to go to the Public Defenders Office in Jefferson today to make arrangements for his indigency evaluation 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess 3:13pm. 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 3/17/15 at 2:00pm.
